review.title: Exact Inference of Hidden Structure from Sample Data in Noisy-OR Networks
review.abstract: In the literature on graphical models, there has been increased attention paid to the problems of learning hidden structure (see Heckerman [H96] for survey) and causal mechanisms from sample data [H96, P88, S93, P95, F98]. In most settings we should expect the former to be difficult, and the latter potentially impossible without experimental intervention. In this work, we examine some restricted settings in which perfectly reconstruct the hidden structure solely on the basis of observed sample data.

sections.text: In most settings, we should assume that the former will be difficult, and that the latter is potentially impossible without experimental intervention. In this thesis, we examine some limited settings in which the ideal can be achieved: efficient algorithms that reconstruct the hidden structure solely on the basis of the observed sample data. In our framework, we assume that the unknown "tar get" values are a two-tiered, noisy-OR network that make a number of assumptions in detail in the newspaper.
